senses.lear_examp: As far as employment is concerned, as people take their pensions at the age of 65 at the latest, new staff cannot be recruited.

senses.sense: If you talk about something at length, you talk for a long time.
senses.dict_examp: We discussed both topics at length.
senses.lear_examp: Since we have already arranged for your family to come to stay in my home and discussed the arrangements at length and in detail, I will no longer bother you with terms of payment and other information that, judging by your letter, seems to be quite irrelevant.

senses.sense: to be allowed to do something
senses.dict_examp: I'm not at liberty to discuss the matter at present.
senses.lear_examp: On the one hand the child is at liberty to do whatever it pleases to do but on the other hand it was never taught the responsibilities implicitly tied to such actions.

senses.sense: not knowing what to do
senses.dict_examp: I'm at a loss to explain his disappearance.
senses.lear_examp: And now I am completely at a loss what to write next.

senses.sense: not knowing what to say
senses.dict_examp: The question was unexpected and she was temporarily at a loss for words.
senses.lear_examp: If it was James I would be at a loss for words, I didn't know what to tell him.

senses.sense: to not be able to protect yourself from something or someone that you cannot control
senses.dict_examp: Farmers are often at the mercy of the weather.
senses.lear_examp: I couldn't believe I'd been careless enough to let them be at the mercy of Joanna's careless, boisterous friends, and I felt very lonely now, looking for them.

senses.sense: to not agree with someone or something
senses.dict_examp: The two brothers were always at odds.
senses.lear_examp: Young people are inexperienced as far as the world is concerned and thus they are frequently at odds with their family.

senses.sense: If something useful is at a premium, there is not enough of it.
senses.dict_examp: Time is at a premium just before the start of exams.
senses.lear_examp: Honesty and accuracy are very good virtues to strive for, but having friendship and a fair and caring relationship to your friend or partner have to be rated at a premium as well.

senses.sense: used before saying what will happen if a situation continues in the same way
senses.dict_examp: At this rate we're not going to be there till midnight.

senses.sense: used before saying one fact that is certain in a situation that you are generally not certain about
senses.dict_examp: Well, at any rate we need her to be there.
senses.lear_examp: Nevertheless, at any rate, we would like to see a society with a full and strong workforce working towards stronger economic power.

senses.sense: If you do something at your own risk, you are completely responsible for anything bad that might happen because of it.
senses.dict_examp: Customers may leave vehicles here at their own risk.
senses.lear_examp: However, when a young man decides to go on a dangerous expedition, he should do so at his own risk and should not rely on help from anyone.

senses.sense: at the young age of 8/17/25, etc.
senses.dict_examp: She first appeared on stage at the tender age of 12.
senses.lear_examp: She met my father at the tender age of 14, and she soon knew that this was the man she wanted to stay with for the rest of her life.

senses.sense: used to talk about an occasion in the past without saying exactly which occasion it was
senses.dict_examp: Most of us have made a similar mistake at one time or another.
senses.lear_examp: Haven't we all at one time or another come home from a holiday feeling healthy and strong with a smile on our face thinking, this is what life is about.

senses.sense: If something is at stake, it is in a situation where it might be lost or damaged.
senses.dict_examp: We have to act quickly - people's lives are at stake.
senses.lear_examp: The whole human race's future is at stake.

senses.sense: to achieve something, especially after a lot of work
senses.dict_examp: She's attained a high level of fitness.
senses.lear_examp: Alternatively, an English speaker from a non-English-speaking country may be of help only if he/she has attained a level higher than yours.

senses.sense: strong, healthy and good at sports
senses.dict_examp: She looks very athletic.
senses.lear_examp: Furthermore, I am not only very athletic, but also really sociable and outgoing.

senses.sense: possible to achieve
senses.dict_examp: We must ensure that we do not set ourselves goals that are not attainable.
senses.lear_examp: As electronic media sources have become more affordable and attainable, more people have access to local and international news and events.

senses.sense: the smallest unit that an element can be divided into
senses.dict_examp: A molecule of carbon dioxide (CO2) has one carbon atom and two oxygen atoms.
senses.lear_examp: Anyway, the manager of that center called me in order to inform me that I would be doing research on nuclear power and atoms.

senses.sense: to try to do something, especially something difficult
senses.dict_examp: He attempted to escape through a window.
senses.lear_examp: It was the second time I had attempted the exam.

senses.sense: when you try to do something
senses.dict_examp: This is my second attempt at the exam.
senses.lear_examp: I made several attempts to make him change his mind, but I failed.

senses.sense: to connect or fix one thing to another
senses.dict_examp: I attached a photo to my application form.
senses.lear_examp: I attach my C.V. and I look forward to discussing it with you.

senses.sense: to connect a file, such as a document, picture or computer program, to an e-mail
senses.lear_examp: I'm going to send you some information about hotels attached to this mail.

senses.sense: to think that someone or something has importance/value, etc.
senses.dict_examp: You attach too much importance to money.
senses.lear_examp: My father  knew exactly when he had to attach importance to feelings or emotions.

senses.sense: to include something as part of something else
senses.dict_examp: There were too many conditions attached to the deal.
senses.lear_examp: Furthermore, the aid provided to these countries is not always innocent and might have strings attached.

senses.sense: when something or someone is available
senses.dict_examp: I checked the availability of flights online and there's plenty of choice.
senses.lear_examp: Therefore, it is essential that you take account of my availability when booking the trip.

senses.sense: the power to make decisions or to control other people
senses.dict_examp: The United Nations has used its authority to restore peace in the area.
senses.lear_examp: Their parents have lost almost all their authority.

senses.sense: someone  with official power to control a particular type of activity
senses.dict_examp: local/health/school autorities
senses.lear_examp: Air pollution and traffic congestions are major issues that have been raised by local authorities very recently.

senses.sense: someone who has a lot of knowledge about a particular subject
senses.dict_examp: She is an authority on seventeenth-century English literature.
senses.lear_examp: I read the book more than six times and I became an authority on the Roman Empire.

senses.sense: the eighth month of the year, after July and before September
senses.dict_examp: the 13th of August/August 13(th)
senses.lear_examp: Dear Jo: The class is going to be the 9th of August.

senses.sense: beautiful or pleasant to look at
senses.dict_examp: an attractive woman
senses.lear_examp: It's very small but attractive.

senses.sense: interesting or useful
senses.dict_examp: an attractive offer/idea
senses.lear_examp: Your big library where you might find some books that are not available in other libraries is undoubtedly very attractive for anyone who loves literature.

senses.sense: a lawyer who represents people in legal matters or speaks for them in court
senses.dict_examp: a defense attorney
senses.lear_examp: An innocent man is arrested and the court appoints an attorney to defend him.

senses.sense: An automatic machine works by itself or with little human control.
senses.dict_examp: automatic doors
senses.lear_examp: It has both manual and automatic functions so it has a lot of possibilities.

senses.sense: done as a natural reaction, without thinking
senses.dict_examp: My automatic response was to pull my hand away.
senses.lear_examp: Her gesture was almost automatic.

senses.sense: certain to happen as part of the normal process or system
senses.dict_examp: You get an automatic promotion after two years.

senses.sense: when someone does a short performance to try to get a job as an actor, singer, etc.
senses.dict_examp: She's got an audition for the show.
senses.lear_examp: Many untalented people think they can sing and attend the auditions, but others laugh at them.

senses.sense: the sister of someone's father or mother, or the wife of someone's uncle
senses.dict_examp: I have an aunt in Australia.
senses.lear_examp: My uncle, my aunt, my cousin and my friends (Renata, Gustavo, John, Paul) came to the party.

senses.sense: to stay away from a person, place, situation, etc.
senses.dict_examp: I try to avoid going downtown on  the weekend.
senses.lear_examp: People despise and avoid her because she is ugly.

senses.sense: to prevent something from happening
senses.dict_examp: I left the room to avoid a fight.
senses.lear_examp: I think that all these problems could have been avoided and that asking for my money back is the best way of forgetting that evening.

senses.sense: to intentionally not do something
senses.dict_examp: She managed to avoid answering my question.
senses.lear_examp: The writer avoided describing personal thoughts.

senses.sense: the people who sit and watch a performance at a theater, hall, outdoors, etc.
senses.dict_examp: There were a lot of children in the audience.
senses.lear_examp: All the people in the audience looked at me, I was very excited. The band called me, so I went to the stage and they started to play a very popular song.

senses.sense: the type of people who watch a particular TV show, read a particular book, etc.
senses.dict_examp: This magazine is aimed at a teenage/young audience.
senses.lear_examp: The above-mentioned restaurants are totally different from each other and suit completely different customers. Pasta, to begin with, is best suited to a younger audience.

senses.sense: a space in a house just under the roof, often used for storing things
senses.dict_examp: There's a large room and additional storage space in the attic.
senses.lear_examp: She had no idea how but she knew she had all the luck she could ever get, from the very old lucky rabbit foot she found up in the attic yesterday.

senses.sense: a sale in which things are sold to the person who offers the most money
senses.dict_examp: The furniture was sold at auction.
senses.lear_examp: And funds could be raised for the changes by holding auctions, runs, parties, raffles, contests etc.

senses.sense: able to be bought, used, or gotten
senses.dict_examp: Do you have any double rooms available this weekend?
senses.lear_examp: I would like to know more details and what facilities are available.

senses.sense: If someone is available, they are not busy and so are able to do something.
senses.dict_examp: Are you available next weekend?
senses.lear_examp: I am available any time.

senses.sense: to give official permission for something
senses.dict_examp: His manager had authorized the expenditure.
senses.lear_examp: If we do that, every piece of data is stored in a place accessible for anyone authorized, for example, you.

senses.sense: to be officially allowed to do something
senses.dict_examp: Only managers are authorized to sign expense forms.
senses.lear_examp: In my capacity as the secretary of the Social Club, I am authorized to express students' dissatisfaction with the facilities of the museum and to urge you to take remedial action toward improving the situation.

senses.sense: to make people come to a place or do a particular thing by being interesting, enjoyable, etc.
senses.dict_examp: The castle attracts more than 300,000 visitors a year.
senses.lear_examp: Although it was the first time that I came to this new class, it attracted me deeply.

senses.sense: to cause people to pay attention/be interested, etc.
senses.dict_examp: Her ideas have attracted a lot of attention in the scientific community.
senses.lear_examp: When I go out with my friends I actually like wearing clothes that attract people's attention.

senses.sense: to like someone because of the way they look or behave
senses.dict_examp: I was attracted to him straight away.
senses.lear_examp: She was really attracted to him.

senses.sense: when you watch, listen to, or think about something carefully or with interest
senses.dict_examp: Ladies and gentlemen, could I have your attention, please?
senses.lear_examp: Thank you for your attention.

senses.sense: to watch, listen to, or think about something carefully
senses.dict_examp: You weren't paying attention to what I was saying.
senses.lear_examp: Larry is a very distracted boy. Everybody says that he should pay attention to what he is doing.

senses.sense: to make someone notice you
senses.dict_examp: I waved at her to get her attention.
senses.lear_examp: The bank is near the school, so the lady was trying to get people's attention while the others robbed the bank.

senses.sense: to make someone notice something or someone
senses.dict_examp: If I could just draw your attention to the second paragraph.
senses.lear_examp: The purpose of his report is to draw attention to videos in English.

senses.sense: to receive more attention than anyone or anything else
senses.dict_examp: He loves to be the center of attention.
senses.lear_examp: He would have so much fun being the center of attention.

senses.sense: to say that something is caused by something else
senses.dict_examp: He attributes his success to hard work.
senses.lear_examp: On the other hand, it might be attributed to the laziness of the people.

senses.sense: a quality or characteristic that someone or something has
senses.dict_examp: Her hair is her best attribute.
senses.lear_examp: What are the attributes of a successful person, then?

senses.sense: something that makes people come to a place or do a particular thing
senses.dict_examp: tourist attractions
senses.lear_examp: At first I only wanted to see the many attractions in Balboa Park.

senses.sense: when you like someone, especially romantically, because of the way they look or behave
senses.dict_examp: We had a strong mutual attraction.
senses.lear_examp: Ever since the beginning, since the day when Olivia met the Nawab for the first time, she felt an inexplicable attraction toward him.

senses.sense: a street, often a wide one, in a city or town
senses.dict_examp: Michigan Avenue in Chicago is famous for its elegant stores.
senses.lear_examp: The demonstrators just spread litter all over the largest and finest avenue.

senses.sense: a possible way of doing or achieving something
senses.dict_examp: We have exhausted all other avenues of treatment.

senses.sense: the writer of a book, article, play, etc.
senses.dict_examp: He is the author of two books on French history.
senses.lear_examp: During the Easter holiday, I read a very good thriller by an Italian author, Andrea Camilleri.

senses.sense: If something is authentic, it is real, true, or what people say it is.
senses.dict_examp: authentic Italian food
senses.lear_examp: I am also nostalgic for authentic Thai culture which has subtly and gradually been replaced by American and European culture.

senses.sense: If a machine does something automatically, it does it independently, without human control.
senses.dict_examp: The camera adjusts the shutter speed automatically.
senses.lear_examp: The television will be automatically switched on in time for the breakfast news.

senses.sense: If you do something automatically, you do it without thinking about it.
senses.dict_examp: I automatically put my hand out to catch it.
senses.lear_examp: There was a strange envelope between the others, so automatically, she picked it up and looked at the stamp. The letter came from Australia.

senses.sense: how you think or feel about something, and how this makes you behave
senses.dict_examp: He has a very bad attitude to/toward work.
senses.lear_examp: The waiters had a very good attitude toward the customers and the food was really wonderful.

senses.sense: not sleeping
senses.dict_examp: I find it so difficult to stay awake late.
senses.lear_examp: She felt so nervous that it kept her awake at night.

senses.sense: to be completely awake
senses.dict_examp: "Is Oliver awake yet?" "Yes, he's wide  awake and running around his bedroom."
senses.lear_examp: Sometimes, when I have put my children to bed, half an hour later an aircraft flies over and my two-year old daughter is wide awake again.

senses.sense: typical and usual
senses.dict_examp: The average person in the street is a lot better off than they were forty years ago.
senses.lear_examp: This makes people believe that a lot of the food we eat is fast-food, but it's not true at all, in fact it's a very small part of our average diet.

senses.sense: An average number is the number you get by adding two or more amounts together and dividing the total by the number of amounts.
senses.dict_examp: an average age/temperature
senses.lear_examp: The weather on this mountain is fantastic, with an average temperature of 17°C.

senses.sense: not particularly good
senses.dict_examp: The meal  was pretty average.
senses.lear_examp: I didn't get the high standard of service that you had offered me, and the food was pretty average.

senses.sense: the result you get by adding two or more amounts together and dividing the total by the number of amounts
senses.dict_examp: Prices have risen by an average of 4% over the past year.
senses.lear_examp: On the table was my mark sheet with the average as 90%.

senses.sense: the usual or typical amount
senses.dict_examp: An 8-hour working day is about the average.
senses.lear_examp: I don't have much time to watch TV and I only spend an average of two to five hours a week.

senses.sense: usually, or based on an average
senses.dict_examp: Female workers earn, on average, a third less than men.
senses.lear_examp: On average, our pupils are 16 years old and they join actively in all the events we organize.

senses.sense: when you know about something
senses.dict_examp: Environmental awareness is increasing all the time.
senses.lear_examp: Thirdly, I have a strong awareness of issues which are important to my local community.

senses.sense: to give money or a prize following an official decision
senses.dict_examp: He was awarded the Nobel Prize for physics.
senses.lear_examp: As you will see, I was awarded a grade A.

senses.sense: a prize given to someone for something they have achieved
senses.dict_examp: the Academy Award for Best Director
senses.lear_examp: He became world-famous when he won the Oscar award for best song last year.

senses.sense: difficult or causing problems
senses.dict_examp: an awkward shape

senses.sense: embarrassing and not relaxed
senses.dict_examp: an awkward situation
senses.lear_examp: Not a movement, not a voice, just an awkward silence.

senses.sense: without beauty, ease, and skill when moving
senses.dict_examp: He’s too awkward – he’ll never be a good dancer.
senses.lear_examp: Piggy's "value" is not apparent to the boys because it is concealed by the sight of his awkward self: he is plump, he wears thick spectacles, he is not gifted with good health.

senses.sense: in a different place, position or situation
senses.dict_examp: Just go away and leave me alone!
senses.lear_examp: I have an important exam on your wedding day in another city far away from my city.

senses.sense: at a particular distance from a place
senses.dict_examp: The nearest town was ten miles away.
senses.lear_examp: I like it because its remote control could control distances of 1 or 2 meters away.

senses.sense: in or into the usual or a suitable place, especially one that can be closed
senses.dict_examp: Could you put the ice-cream away in the freezer?
senses.lear_examp: I am going to put all the toys away.

senses.sense: at a particular time in the future
senses.dict_examp: My English exam's only a week away and I haven't even started to prepare.
senses.lear_examp: Christmas is just a few months away, and I do not intend to spend it all alone like in the past few years, so I am writing to invite you to my real Christmas party without my parents.

senses.sense: gradually disappearing until mostly or completely gone
senses.dict_examp: All the snow had melted away.
senses.lear_examp: I always feel so fatigued at the end of the day but after a mile, the aches of the day seem to fade away.

senses.sense: If a sports team is playing away, the game is at the place where the other team usually plays.
senses.dict_examp: They were playing away.

senses.sense: used after a verb to mean "continuously" or "repeatedly"
senses.dict_examp: Chris was hammering away in the garden all day.
senses.lear_examp: They chatted away for a while as Malcolm had to wait for the airport taxi.

senses.sense: very bad, of low quality, or unpleasant
senses.dict_examp: The weather was awful.
senses.lear_examp: We wanted to go shopping in Oxford Street but everything is too expensive and the weather was awful.

senses.sense: a very large amount
senses.dict_examp: It cost an awful lot of money.
senses.lear_examp: First of all, I want to highlight that we see an awful lot of mobile phones in our daily life.

senses.sense: extremely good
senses.dict_examp: Your new haircut is awesome.
senses.lear_examp: My birthday party was awesome!

senses.sense: great or special and causing deep feelings of admiration, respect, or sometimes fear
senses.dict_examp: an awesome achievement
senses.lear_examp: Italy is crowded by groups sheepishly following their guides in an awesome silence and respect.

senses.sense: not sleeping
senses.dict_examp: I find it so difficult to stay awake late.
senses.lear_examp: She felt so nervous that it kept her awake at night.

senses.sense: to be completely awake
senses.dict_examp: "Is Oliver awake yet?" "Yes, he's wide  awake and running around his bedroom."
senses.lear_examp: Sometimes, when I have put my children to bed, half an hour later an aircraft flies over and my two-year old daughter is wide awake again.

senses.sense: a feeling of great respect and sometimes fear
senses.dict_examp: I was filled with awe at the sheer size of the building.
senses.lear_examp: As a child growing up, the presence of my grandmother filled me with awe.

senses.sense: to feel great respect for and sometimes fear of someone
senses.dict_examp: As children we were rather in awe of our grandfather.
senses.lear_examp: As I was the eldest of the siblings, they used to respect all my orders and even now, they are a bit in awe of me.

senses.sense: knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing
senses.dict_examp: Were you aware of the risks at the time?
senses.lear_examp: First of all, we aren't aware of the necessity of learning such things as biology or math.
